pros: Great staff. Good benefits as well
cons: not really too many cons. You have the good days and the bad days

pros: Some great co-workers. Sometimes understanding.
cons: Short staffed. The employees who have worked here 10+ years have seniority and basically make up there own rules. Drama. Bullying. Physical harassment, with no repercussions. Being a union, they pretty get away with anything. Empty promises , especially if someone throws a fit, tho you worked your way up, or shown you deserve what you were promised. Too worried about low staff, so they just let people get away with whatever. Disrespectful. Will serve expired food or rotten lettuce and fruit. The quality isn't there. Alot of lazy workers, but since they have been there longer than management, no one will say anything ! 3 of the best managers transferred out, because they obviously gave up, and don't want those bad reviews and scores to reflect on them. When you're local and are willing to drive a hour away, just to get away from the toxic work environment, that should be your sign ! Hold people back with more than enough qualifications and experience.

pros: No education needed for job, and they train on the job. Prn you make your own schedule

pros: Very nice staff, although there are many issues with the managers.

pros: your co-workers are nice but they all hate their jobs too

I had a supervisor change my therapy goals and print my evaluations and write on them in red ink like I was back in graduate school. You may be sold on opportunities for "clinical advancement" but I was declined opportunities every time I expressed interest. They play favorites and equality is not valued in this company. I would never recommend working here.

pros: Good team of coworkers, work well together

pros: Patient Care Experience is a plus.

job_title: Staff RN Progressive Care Unit in Bradenton, FL
pros: Co-workers are nice. They REALLY TRY to help each other.
cons: Assignments are so unsafe. 6 to 7 patients. It does not matter if you have patients on drips. Most of the time with 1 PCA in a floor with 42 patients. Meditech (charting system) is a nightmare. They expect you to do everything! Even the housekeeping tasks! Everyday they will add a stupid rule to make your work harder. The new one is that you can 't removed all your meds at once. Which it was already inconvenient having to log in 2 different computers to pull meds. If you have 7 patients, you have to log in more than 14 times just to pass your 0900 or 2100 scheduled meds! Stay away from this place!! Also their pay sucks.

pros: Awesome ppl to work with
cons: They dint give much raises

pros: salary, coworkers, food, schedule, hours

pros: You can already find work here

pros: Everything is good love it

review_title: Amazing people trapped in a terrible place.
pros:
-The team is phenomenal. A true family.
-Best anesthesia I've ever worked with.
-A handful of the surgeons (Dr. Pennebacker. The Valadie brothers, and Dr. Phillips to name a few) are absolute delights to work with!
cons:
-Terrible pay and no chance of bonuses.
-Understaffed in ALL nursing departments all over the hospital.
-if you're on call just expect to be there all 16 hours that day.
-Weekends were for emergencies, but now they're just another day to work because administration can't say no.
-CONSTANTLY out of supplies. Can't even stock blankets. (I've had to use fitted sheets to keep my patients warm)
-Won't hire people for an overwhelmingly understaffed sterile processing department so always having to flash instruments and trays just to get through the day.

This was a nice, small town hospital whose Administration wanted to make a lot more money so they picked up trauma and burns and haven't supplied anybody with the means to succeed with such additions. Most people I've talked with are looking elsewhere for a job. Truly sad to see what has happened.

review_title: Do you not work there! Extremely understaffed and unappreciated
pros: Some of my co-workers were fantastic
cons: Understaffed, outdated equipment, horrible management and upper management. They will kill your spirit

pros: Working in the ER is a great team effort. The doctors and nurses work well together to take care of patients. The doctors are very open to nursing suggestions, and always treat nurses with respect. Each team member contributes to patient care, you never feel like you are alone. The management team shows that they care by rounding on patients on a daily basis and making changes based on that feedback. You often see management talking individually with staff to ask them questions about them. Also they have a fun committee to keep team building. The doctors are also very good to nurses and take us out to keep us close and team building. Great environment to work in. I have no intentions of leaving any time soon!
cons: Sometimes handoffs to the floors can be difficult.

pros: Large supportive department, opportunities to work in a variety of areas: Acute Care, Inpatient Rehab, Outpatient, and Pediatrics.  Multiple specialty areas include Stroke, Brain Injury, Trauma, Burn, Hand Clinic, and Joint Care Center, to name a few.
cons:
Therapists rotate weekend coverage, average 1 time per month.  
Bradenton is seasonal, summers are slower while winters are busier.  Seasonal staffing/contract labor used in season to assist with increased census.  Overtime permitted, but not required.

job_title: Critical Care Nurse in Bradenton, FL
pros: The daytime critical care team is second to none! Fun, energetic, kind, compassionate, and intelligent. Always willing to go the extra mile and make every person on the team feel like family!
cons: You are 100% disposable, no matter your worth to the team, department, or hospital.

review_title: Great therapy team with an environment that fosters new learning with the patient's best interest at heart!
pros: I am part of a team of medical professionals that go above and beyond to meet the needs of our patients. I am respected and heard by our physicians when it comes to a patient's needs and safety.
cons: As all facilities go, we are in need of new talent to invigorate growth and ideas. We are a growing family beach town that is sometimes overlooked by the up and coming!

pros: Worked with some of the finest in the profession. Competitive wages. Stellar docs. Many learning opportunities and professional growth.
cons:
Started out smaller community hospital but grew to larger trauma hospital losing some of the 
that more personal deliverance in care. Staffing issues became more if a regular thing as years passed.

pros: Nice friendly co-workers for the most part, they have a good volunteer corp so you aren't doing a lot of things you have to do in smaller hospitals, like run to lab, DC patients etc.
cons: Definitely understaffed, management is all about the budget, which I know isn't uncommon, a few shifts I really felt unsafe with the nurse:paient ratio., the cafeteria food is nasty.

pros:
- added a trauma center (good for community)
- good benefits for full time employees
- staff mostly nice
- has a great ER and ICU as well as stroke center
cons:
- Staff worked like dogs 
- PTO can be a pain to get to use during season(Dec - May)
- Staff complains alot due to recurring issues
- some departments are understaffed

pros: I would definitely have to say management. I hands down have the best management. Also, the flexibility is awesome. I have a second job and my Blake supervisor and director  are extremely understanding and considerate. My actual coworkers are pretty great as well for the majority.
cons: The pay is quite low in my opinion.

pros: Great organization, truly has a family feel (which is rare in a facility this size).  Leadership has a true focus on quality and what the patient needs.
cons: Lots of unrest currently with a significant changes in the ranks of senior management.  Overall making changes for the better, though.

review_title: Blake medical center Bradenton ,Florida . case management department provides great medical environment
job_title: RN Case Manager in Bradenton, FL
pros:
Blake medical center truly a great hospital to work
case management department very unique. a great group of professionals working together for  best patient outcomes. awesome support from senior management.
cons:
no negative comments 
Blake is a great medical institution providing the best 
healthcare and putting the patients needs first.
management provides open door policy always available to assist

pros: I loved working with trauma patients & making a difference in peoples lives. Also, being fulltime & able to work 3, 12 hour shifts a week.
cons:
I worked nursing at Blake for 10 years, in the first 3 years it was great. After a change of senior management everything went downhill FAST! Staffing is horrible & management promised for years it would get better, but in fact it got worse; alot of employees were either fired or fed up. The nurse/cna to patient ratio is scary & stressful to both patients and staff. They pull nurses & cnas from different units and throw them onto other units.  This becames a unsafe environment because different units in a trauma hospital requires special training.   Being that Blake is a union company pay is the lowest among all the area hospitals.  You also don't get raises for your ability or patient care, you get a raise when the union decides. When I was working at Blake I once waited 3 years for a raise. Also, alot of units have either broken or not enough equipment(for example dinnemaps).
   It is so sad because when I started at Blake as a new nurse, I had such high hopes for the vision of Blake & the direction for which it was going. When I finally left I felt a huge weight off my shoulders & all of the stress disappeared. Blake lost so many talented & dedicated individuals & with that Blakes rating got lower and lower. Knowing now, if I were a patient I would go to a different hospital & also definitely not recommend any of my friends to start working their.

pros: Great Benefits, wonderful physicians and coworkers, good orientation, always trying to be on the cutting edge of new processes, procedures, and online Electronic Health Record.
cons: Need better communication and staffing....trys to keep under the budget/numbers versus simply trying to meet the monthly numbers.

pros: Decent pay and benefits for full time staff.
cons: Lack of support from senior leadership. They have the answers to the issues as long as it doesn't require extra work effort on their part.

pros: They hire new grads which was what I was at the time of hire.
cons: High turnover, no CNAs and up to 8 patients to one nurse, very difficult to manage especially on nights when you have multiple fall risk and dementia patients and total care patients

job_title: Chief Financial Officer in Bradenton, FL
pros: I enjoy working at Blake Medical Center.  The employees are really great to work with and are supportive of the community.
cons: There is a lack of growth in the area where the hospital resides.  The overall community seems reluctant to change with the times.

pros: benefits, immediate supervisor, coworkers, patients
cons: New administration all about the bottom line, don’t seem to care about patient care.  Many departments short staffed because pay is not competitive, directors are allowed to bully staff.  Blake used to promote quality care by listening and including staff  in decisions.  Now it’s a toxic place with unrealistic expectations from admin staff who never leave the safety of their cubicle.,

pros: Team atmosphere, everyone focused on excellent patient care and making our employees happy.
cons: Healthcare can be a tough business.  Blake seems to always understand that and make efforts to appreciate employees.

review_title: More Than a Decade at Blake
pros: Staff on unit are like family.  We know and support each other.  Committed to patient safety and great outcomes.
cons: Recent leadership changes have provided some challenges, but have re-affirmed the importance of unit cohesion.

pros: Great team to work with
